file_content.text: My captors deserved torment, and you delivered.
The Republic fought hard to protect this data.
Oh, this is good. Prison schematics, and what's this? Hidden inmates, a World Razer? More is locked up here than we imagined.
This moment is as sweet as I always imagined. I'm in your debt.
My revenge is yours to inflict.
The Empire's employing aliens now? How times have changed.
Let me get a look at you. Ah, delightful. You're the first woman I've seen in ages.
Come close. I can't stand solitude any longer.
Twenty-four years I've been imprisoned on Belsavis. The Republic thought they could contain me, but the Empire proved them wrong.
You must be eager to have your revenge.
Welcome back.
You have no idea.
If someone chained me down, I'd obliterate an entire planet to sever my bonds.
What a horrible fate.
Belsavis is built to hold those with our power. Fortunately, you'll never suffer my torment.
When we're done, there won't be a locked cell left on this planet.
The Empire has much to prove.
And I won't leave until we've ground my captors to dust!
I'm guessing you weren't about to get time off for good behavior.
Rough sentence.
I didn't receive much mercy after obliterating half a planet.
Identify yourself.
You haven't heard of the great Lord Ferrid? I stole a Republic superweapon and turned it against the miserable cretins. How I cherish the memory.
You aren't that important.
I'm aware Commander Calum is after the Dread Masters, but don't underestimate my power.
Every second of imprisonment, I nursed my hatred for the Republic. Finally, the time has come for my revenge.
When the Empire released me, the Republic army retreated to their compound to erect defenses. Something vital is behind those fortified walls.
Protecting what?
I'm not sure, but the last time I saw such heavy safeguards, they were trying to stop me from seizing their superweapon.
Belsavis is Republic territory, yet they run and hide.
Cowards.
It's fear that drives them. Not of us, but of what we'll do if we obtain whatever they guard.
You're sure about that?
Just look at their compound. The last time I saw such safeguards, the Republic was guarding a top secret superweapon from yours truly.
I hunger for their destruction, but I'm too weak to crush their defenses. This battle is yours.
Obliterate the Republic compound, recover what they protect and then bring it to me.
Their prize will soon be ours.
I hope their base isn't empty.
I'm right. I know it.
Crush their turrets, then tear the base apart until you've found what the Republic hides.
And don't leave without slaying the guard captain. He's crushed riots before, and we can't risk the Republic's treasure falling back into his hands.
Sorry, old man. [Refuse quest]
You may walk away, but I'll never leave so long as my captors breathe.
So this is freedom.
